thread.title: Three to die for 2010 murder of Faridpur jute trader
thread.title_full: Three to die for 2010 murder of Faridpur jute trader

title: Three to die for 2010 murder of Faridpur jute trader
text:
Three to die for 2010 murder of Faridpur jute trader Faridpur Correspondent bdnews24.com A Faridpur court has sentenced three people to death for murdering a jute trader in 2010. 
Additional Sessions Judge Musrat Zerin issued the verdict on Thursday. Two of the convicts – Md Jamir Ali, 27, and Md Enamul Kabir alias Enamul Kazi, 29, - are in jail while the other, Mintu Sheikh, is absconding, Public Prosecutor Khandaker Jahid Hossain Joy said.
Referring to the case dossier, he said the convicts, all hailing from Chandpur village of Sadar Upazila, hacked jute trader Gias Uddin to death near Barokhada Bridge on Oct 20, 2010. 
The victim’s wife Shiuly Begum started a case naming the trio and two to three unidentified persons the same day.
